intro: Ervatamia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly spicy scent. Ervatamia biflora is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
